text: I remember being 10 yrs old and had no idea how to fix this area. Because i didn't speak english i had to call that nintendo service line, and they gave me wrong answers. At that time i was at my grandparents, when my mother came to pick me up and i explained something about this game, she asked me why i didn't try something which i was like no that doesn't work. So ok, i give it a try and yes that was how to solve the puzzle. She never played any videogame and i was like !!!??.??

text: Never got OOA? Lo, a shame. I'd recommend finding a way to play both. OOS is a great game, but what really sets the Oracles apart from the rest of Zelda is the way the two stories in two different countries interact with each other and with Hyrule. It's strange. The very thing that makes me think they deserve a squeal is probably the same thing that's kept them from making it.

author: MajorasMask65

text: Well, have you played "Four Swords Adventures?" Twas like a 16 bit game but on the 100+ bit Gamecube instead of the SNES or GBA. The great graphics gap allowed the game to do things most can't, primarily relating to large numbers of individual moving objects sharing the screen & flowing animation. If an 8 bit Secrets were on the WiiU, the gap would be 8 to 6/700+. Even on the 3DS this game could be enormous. A big problem is that the Oracles were the lowest selling Zelda games, or so I've heard.
author: Weesnauh

Luckily, I finished both before I had lost them, but THAT DOESN'T MAKE UP FOR THE FACT THAT I WANNA PLAY ORACLE OF SEASONS FOR THE MILLIONTH TIME!!!
Yes, the caps are used to show how much I regret misplacing this game. *Goes to look for it.*

author: heyjeySigma

text:
Zelda: Oracle of Seasons and Ages are severely underrated. It has a fresh and new start that both returns to the original Zelda roots while it explores new opportunities in 2-Dimensional gameplay. And of course, a beatiful soundtrack that uses the small Gameboy Colour for all it's worth. 

The reason why I don't like Minish Cap and Phantom Hourglass is because I liked these two far more...
